Error.PackIndexNotFound: The compendium pack from which the character class was imported not found in this world

Permissions.NeedCreateActorError: User requires the 'Create New Actors' permission. Ask your DM to add it to your role
Permissions.NeedCreateItemWarn: User without 'Create New Items' permission. You will not be able to create custom Features
Permissions.NeedFileUploadWarn: User without 'Upload New Files' permission. You might experience issues selecting images
Permissions.NeedFileBrowseWarn: User without 'Use File Browser' permission. You might experience issues selecting images

AllowManualInput.Name: Allow manual input
AllowManualInput.Hint: Allow the user to manually input the ability scores

AllowStandardArray.Name: Allow standard array
AllowStandardArray.Hint: Allow the user to use the standard array

AllowPointBuy.Name: Allow point buy
AllowPointBuy.Hint: Allow the user to use the point buy system

AllowRolling.Name: Allow rolling
AllowRolling.Hint: Allow the user to roll for the ability scores

PointBuyLimit.Name: Point Buy Limit
PointBuyLimit.Hint: Set the maximum points allowed for the point buy system. Values higher than this threshold will show in red.

AbilityRollFormula.Name: Formula used to roll stats (per stat)

debug.Name: Enable debug mode
debug.Hint: Provides additional logging for debugging purposes

debugHooks.Name: Enable extended debugging mode
debugHooks.Hint: Provides additional logging of all Foundry hooks

DefaultGoldDice.Name: Default starting gold roll
DefaultGoldDice.Hint: Here you can customize the starting gold dice rolled on the tool

DonationTrackerEnabled.Name: Enable Donation Tracker
DonationTrackerEnabled.Hint: Enable the donation tracker to show the current donation amount and goal

DisableAdvancementMove.Name: Disable Advancement Tab
DisableAdvancementMove.Hint: Prevents advancements from being captured in the Advancements Tab. Instead they will appear as default for the system â€“ i.e. as a dialog popup window.

DisableOtherActorCreationOptionsForPlaye.Name: Disable other Create Actor button
DisableOtherActorCreationOptionsForPlaye.Hint: Prevents players from creating actors using the standard Create Actor button. Only Actor Studio will be available.

DonationTrackerRank.Name: Rank
DonationTrackerRank.Hint: Enter the folder name for the rank

DonationTracker_UnregisteredAccess.Name: Unregistered Access
DonationTracker_UnregisteredAccess.Hint: If ticked, unregistered users will have access to anything outside of DT folders in DT linked compendiums

DonationTrackerAction.Name: Add DT folders
DonationTrackerAction.Hint: Add the Donation Tracker membership level folders to this compendium

DonationTracker.Name: Donation Tracker settings
DonationTracker.Label: Edit
DonationTracker.Hint: Enable / Disable the integration, and each donation tracker membership level has a folder name. You can edit them here.

DontShowWelcome.Name: Don't show this message again
DontShowWelcome.Hint: Don't show the welcome application when Foundry first loads. (You can always undo this via Configure Settings).

EnableLevelUp.Name: Enable Level Up
EnableLevelUp.Hint: Check this to include a button on the character sheet for leveling up via Actor Studio

forceDnd5eLevelUpAutomation.Name: Force D&D5e Level Up Automation
forceDnd5eLevelUpAutomation.Hint: Without this the Actor Studio is pretty much useless other that for previewing options as it won't be able to apply the changes to the actor

milestoneLeveling.Name: Milestone Levelling
milestoneLeveling.Hint: If unchecked, the Level Up button will only be shown when the Actor has sufficient XP to level up. If checked, the button will always be shown and the user will be able to level up without having the required XP.

ShowRolls.Name: Show rolls on chat
ShowRolls.Hint: Show ability score, hp per level and starting gold rolls as chat messages

showButtonInSideBar.Name: Show button in sidebar
showButtonInSideBar.Hint: Show the Actor Studio button in the sidebar. (Requires a browser refresh to take effect)

IndividualPanelScroll.Name: Individual panel scrolls
IndividualPanelScroll.Hint: In tabs with left and right panels, make each side have independent scrolls

UseTokenizer.Name: Use Tokenizer if available
UseTokenizer.Hint: The tool will try to use the Tokenizer module, if found, as default to generate avatar and token pictures

EquipmentBlacklist.Name: Equipment Blacklist
EquipmentBlacklist.Hint: Items (Equipment) not shown for purchase, by name (case-sensitive, separated by ';', spaces are ok). Only 'common' rarity items are shown, but this list excludes the few magical/unreasonable common items. Default - 'Potion of Climbing; Potion of Healing; Spell Scroll 1st Level; Spell Scroll Cantrip Level; Unarmed Strike'

SubraceNameBlacklist.Name: Subrace Names Blacklist
SubraceNameBlacklist.Hint: Items excluded by name from been Subraces (case-sensitive, separated by ';', spaces are ok). Used by default to exclude things like Gnome Cunning from registering as Gnome subclasses. Default - 'Gnome Cunning; Halfling Nimbleness'

ButtonOnDialogInsteadOfActorsDirectory.Name: Create Actor dialog button
ButtonOnDialogInsteadOfActorsDirectory.Hint: If the button interferes with other modules, or you prefer the aesthetic of having a single 'create actor' button to not confuse your players

NonGmsCanOnlyCreatePCs.Name: Non-GMs can only create PCs
NonGmsCanOnlyCreatePCs.Hint: If enabled, non-GMs will only be able to create Player Characters, not other actor types

WindowX.Name: Actor Studio application window width
WindowX.Hint: Set the initial width for the window here

WindowY.Name: Actor Studio application window height
WindowY.Hint: Set the initial height for the window here

Sources.Name: Compendium Sources
Sources.Hint: Select the compendia that will serve as data source for the different creation steps
Sources.Label: Select sources

TrimSubclasses.Name: Trim Subclass names
TrimSubclasses.Hint: Shows subclass names without any last part in parenthesis, mostly for DDBImporter subclasses like 'Assassin (Rogue)' to be just 'Assassin' (does NOT modify the items added to actor, just show they are shown in the tool)

EnableEquipmentSelection.Name: Enable Equipment Selection
EnableEquipmentSelection.Hint: Allows players to select their starting equipment during character creation. If disabled, equipment will need to be added manually after creation.

Equipment.SelectOne: Select one of the following options:
